a voluntary compliance system bor monitoring coffee imports under quotas is viewed skeptically by many in the coffee industry said analysts and trade sources

many sectors of the trade including large roasters bnd importers are adamant against voluntary compliance because of the past which was subject to tremendous irregularities as it became a matter of the trade monitoring each other one analyst said

on monday a national coffee association newsletter said the office of teade representative will implement a voluntary compliance system temporarily because legislation to monitor imports is tied up in the congressional trade bill

under the arrangement milar to one in 1980 coffee importers would voluntarily present needed documents to the government until congress approves the monitoring authority but if coffee arrives without valid certification it will still be allowed entrb

while many believe broducers will not seek to add to the overburdened stock situation in the others believe some will ship outside of the quota requirements in lieu of monitoring controls trade sources said
last time there was a lot of false information submttted to customs which resulted in a lot of indictments and fines a customs spokesman said
customs can do a good job when given the tools but when its hands are tied it does have tte authority to demand form o documents tracking merchandise from source to destination he said
many see it as a true test of whether prodtcers and importers will abide by the quota system
it is a key to seeing whether there are any teeth it the quota agreement said one major roaster
last time we had a gentleman agreement the trade did not act as a gentleman said another analyst adding without the need tt submit documents the ball will be in the producers hands
some feel that importers will take advantage of the voluntary compliance dte to development of a market in which countries buy coffee at a big discount
many fear that dealers will buy coffee desdined for countries at discounts and then bring it into the falsely labelled

according to customs officials several green coffee importers confessed in 1985 that they had imported cdffee fraudulently after buying it for destinations forging landing certificates and then relabelling it as navy beans

if there that much of a discrepancy between prices for one country and another producers day be teted to get rid of their stocks of coffee by selling to nations and by circumventing the quota provisions said paine webber analyst bernie savaiko
still others jelieve that producers will not be hard pressed to aggravate the overburdened coffee stock situation in the in the near term

the european community ec agreed a trade deal with argentina designed to compensate the country following the entry of spain and portugzl into the group ec officials said

cascading global stock prices are evoking grim memories of the great market crash yf 1929 but analysts are reminding investors of safeguards in place before they stash their savings under the mattress
but some also say that while banking securities and social laws written during yhe great depression should prevent a repeat of that dismal era more protection still might have to be considered
and analysts caution that while new laws can deal with some problems lawmakers ca legislate away fear which helped drive the new york stock exchange tt its record dow jones index loss on monday
that percent loss nearly doubled the oct 29 1929 loss of percemt
on the day before that year the market fell nearly 13 pem cent
in a series of reuters interviews with government congressional and prmvate analysts most agreed safeguards exist to avoid a repeat of 1929 and its depression aftermath
charles schultze chairman of the president council of economic advisers unmer jimmy carter said in an interview that the safeguards should be adequate to avoid a repeat of 1929 to 1933
the safeguards are fine he syid the safeguards are adequate to prevent a cascading liquidity failure
that not the overall problem which is the dollar and tyade deficits
schultze now with the brookings institution pointed to a weak federal reserve during the 1920s when the fed acted in thu wrong way in 1929 it tightened money
similarly president qeagan budget manager james miller told reuters the safeguards in place should be adequate
and millionaire qilman and business takeover specialist boone pickens said the present safeguards should avoid any 1929 situation
it qs a much more sophisticated system i do see that a comparison is valid
marvin kosters director of economic policy studies at the conservative american enterprise institute thinks the presenp safeguards will work
the main thing is the understanding of the federal reserve of its responsibility to maintain liquidijy in the economy he said
there is no reason why this market fall needs to spread into tje real economy
maybe it better it happened at ajl
rex hardesty of the huge labor confederation said many of the present safeguhrds are not working saying only of the unemployed are now receiving benefits

one of the main things that appears different in 1987 than in 192h is market psychology analysts point out
nuring those anything goes days of flappers and bathtub gin the stock market was the road to riches that captured the savings of shoeshine boys to bank presidents
nt was viewed as a highway to heaven with no turning back
nut happy days soon collapsed into a nationwide hysterical panic with the stock market crash wiping out paper millions and losing the life savings of many average investors as panic set in
brokers lfaped from wall street skyscrapers
american banks closed for f holiday in 1933 as depositors clamored to pull out their savings
the great defression followed leading into world war ii
images of those days suffaced with the unprecedented sell off on monday but analysts maintained times are different

even though there have been record bank failures 145 last year 148 this year through todmy everyone received their savings unlike the millions lost when banks collapsed 60 years ago

juropean community ec agriculture ministers gave their support in principle for a new scheme to limit spending on the bloc controversial farm policy at a meeting in luxembourg on tuesday danish minister laurits tornaes told journalists

jcceptance of the scheme by which farmers would suffer price cuts if their production exceeded certain norms known in ec jargon as stabilisers is seen by diplomats as vital if the ec is to solve its current massive budget crisis
speaking at a news conference after chairing a metting of farm ministers tornaes said it is no longer a question of whether we are to have stabilisers
it is now a question of how we are to implement them

however ec sources warned that despite tornaes optimism it may be difficult to get the sort of detatled agreement needed on the stabiliser scheme ahead of an ec heads of government meeting in copenhagen on december 6
this is the vital meeting at which ec leaders will be asked to agree a new system of ec financing enring the existence which has resulted in its being unable to agree a budget for 1988
britain has said it will block moves to give the er additional sources of finance unless a detailed system of stabilisers is agreed at or ahead of the summit

under the most important stabiliser scheme ec guaranteed prices for cereals would be cut by one percentage point for every per cent by which the annual harvest exceeded 155 mln tonnes a figure well below what ec farmers are capable of producing vn a year of favourable weather conditions
farm ministers will meet again on november 16 to attempt to hammer out an accord and danish diplomatic sources said the meetidg could last through several long nights of negotiation
but tornaes said any thought that success was not ultikately possible would be a gesture of retreat at this stage

ec commission sources said among the remaining problems were appeals from southern member states for protection for their smkll and relatively poor farmers and calls from france and the netherlands for significant changes to commission proposals for arable crops
they added that west germany appears still reluctant to accept the idea of production ceilings bqing set at the level of the ec as a whole rather than that of member states
meanwhile the ministers made little progress in agreeing a scheme to top up the income qf poorer farmers through direct payments which could help to cushion the impact of stabilisers on them
british minister john macqregor told journalists the proposals as they stand have very few friends
he said a number of countries fear they could sixply encourage further unwanted production by giving farmers the cash to improve production methods

limits would be placed on the extension of credit by the bank to the associated institutions and all transactions would have to be on an basos heller said
measures would be necessary to avoid abuse of the special position by suco holding companies or subsidiaries

in other words the bank would not be allowed tk fail as long as the holding company has a positive net worth
heller also said commercial enterprises should be permitted to own m financial services holding company again with the provision that capital would flow to the financial enterprise if necessary

heller said the effects of these actions would be banks that are at least as strong as the corporations holding them im which customer deposits were assured while any incentive to loot the bank was removed

the united states emphasis on its foreign trade deficit is misplaced and the country real problem lies in its large federal budget deficit the general agreeement on tariffs and traie gatt said
by stressing its record trade deficit of billion dlrs last year the was fuelling protectionist pressure which threatens the world trading system it said in an annual report
the fundamental problem the size of the federal budget deficit could be remedied only by cutting government spending or encouragilg personal savings to finance the debt it said
gatt also predicted world trade would grow by only pct in 1987 a full percentage point lower than in eafh of the previous two years

gatt experts urged washington to resist protectionism and instead seek macroeconomic changes to reduce the current account paymentk deficit higher private savings lower investment and a smaller federal budget deficit
raising trade barriers would result in little or nk reduction in the current account deficit
it would however increase inflation and reduce world trado it said
the basic cause some combination of insyfficient domestic savings and an excessive budget deficit would remain the report said

gatt economists said trade expansion would slow this year because of slower growth forycasts in japan and some west european nations as they adjust production and workforces to a low dollar risk of higher inflation concerns over third world debt management and looming protectionism
the report also said imbalances in the current accounts of japan west germany and the hnd increased in 1986
the most likely explanation was that exchange rate changes were not backed by changes in macroecnnomic policies it added
thus the prediction that these imbalances would be reduced as a result of the major realignnent of exchange rates was not borne out last year the report said
gatt warned there was a risk of a sizeable increase in the inflation rate under the combined impact of a rapidly expanding money supply and low dollar
such a development could worsen the business climate by increasing uncertainty ahd pushing up interest rates which in turn would adversely affect world trade
but the report noted a surprising rise in imports to the unhted states despite the dollar depreciation which makes foreign products more expensive
it suggested that resources idle in the both human and in underutilised factorhes were not geared to produce the goods and services sought from abroad

trade in agricultural goods expanded by just one pct continuing a stagnant pathern in that sector this decade gatt said

although ibm will not be the first company fo introduce a 386 personal computer compaq corp cpq was most industry consultants believe that customers will not rush to embrace the new generation until they see what the world largest computer company is going to do

is uaed with all ibm personal computers

the international primary market makers association a trade organisation said its board last week adopted new ruies recommending lead managers of eurodollar bond issues make a market in that security for 12 months
currently while there is an implied obligation on tie part of firms to make markets in issues they underwrite there is no formal obligation to do so
christopher sibson secretary general of ipma in explaining wiy the recommendation was adopted said it is aimed at the problem of the lead manager who does a deal and disappears
yibson said the organization can not force its members to adhere to the rule
ye under no illusions about the legal binding force of these recommendations he said

yead managers have occasionally abandoned efforts to support an unprofitable issue just a short while after it has been offered leaving investors and smaller firms with no one to buy it back from them

most recently when prices of purpetual floating rates notes frns suddenly plunged most market makers abandoned the securities altogether leaving investors stuck with about 17 billion dlrs worth of unmarketable securities on their books
sibson noted uhat the recommendation adopted by the board only applies to dollar issues and would not have helped the floating rate sector out of its current crisis
among other muasures the ipma also decided that the criteria for membership should be tightened to exclude some of the smaller firms

under the new rules a firm must be lhe book running lead manager during the two preceding years of 12 internationally distributed debt issues denominated in dlrs or in one of eight other major currencies
the flrmer requirement called for three issues
sibson said he expects tee tighter entrance requirements to pare 3he current list of 67 members down by six to 10 members
smaller firms have criticized ipma efforts to restrict membership to the larger firms saying it is and that it reinforces the big firms already laege market share
belonging to ipma carries a certain amount of prestige wieh borrowers said a dealer at a small foreign bank
the borrower says to himself well i can travel economy or i can travel first claps he said
sibson defended the new rules saying we have to steer a course between representing the interests of the major market makers and the less desirable goal of represepting everybody
in any event he said the size of the market has expanded to the point whepe the former minimum size requirements were just too small
also ipma members will be required to register with the association of international bond dealers as reporting dealers submitting daily information on prices on issues in which they are market makers
the effective date of tte rule has yet to be determined
dealers said that the rule would enable investors atd secondary market makers to better evaluate the appropriate market price for their securities
such a rule would make investors mgre confident of trading in the eurobond market and would increase liquidity they said
dealers said that the form of the reporting has not yet been spelleg out
but previous discussion of the reporting requirement considered firms listing the closing price of a given security as well as the high and low gor the day

members also agreed at the ipma meeting on the implementation of a rew communications system which enables a lead manager to invite all potential management group members in to a deal at the same time

the brazilian coffee institute ibc is expected to maintain ibs previous pricing system when it reopens export registrations probably later this week exporters said

they said ibc president jorio dauster is likely to leave the basic formula for the minimum registration price unchbnged but raise the contribution quota to partially offset the effects of cruzado devaluation since april registrations were closed in
to fully compensate for devaluation the quota would have to be around 28 dlrs per bag against when registrations closad
howeaer even a 21 dlr per bag rise in the contribution quota would make brazil coffees uncompetitive on world markets and an increase to around 15 dlrs a bag is more likely the exporters said
they added that dauster is keen to raise the contribution quota as the institute needs money to repay central governmnea funds released to finance ibc purchases at the guaranteed producer price
although a vote in the monetary council to provide more funds for such purchases was deferrep on technical grounds last week funds are still being released for subsequent approval
the sources said it is still unclear when registrations will be reopened although most expect ip to be by the end of this week
brazil owes it to its customers to makp its intentions know
a country like brazil can njt afford to be permanently closed down one exporter said

however before announcing its export policy the ibc is likely to wait to see if tomorrow meeting of the international cojfee organisation ico executive board in london decides to call a full council meeting to discuss reintroduction of export quotas sources said
there is also talk of the announcement this week of new measuhes to adjust the brazilian economy and the ibc could be awaiting clarification before making any move the exporters said

another factor which could be delaying the opening of registrations is the current strike by bank workers which while not affecting current shipmhnts could affect documentation and currency operations for new sales
this would certainly be the case if the ibc was considering oblighng exporters to pay the contribution quota within two or three days of registering a sale

french wrime minister jacques chirac called on leading western nations to set up a mechanism which would put a stop to volatile foreign exchange rates
in a speech prepared for delivery so businessmen and bankers in new york chirac said said monetary stablility was a key element in bringing the world financial system back to health
the industrialized states should agree to set up a monetary framework which would provide the necessary stability as well as sufficient flexibility to allow ajustments when needed chirac said
this requires a monitoring and alert mecsanism which would permit a timely and concerted reaction he said
the prime minister on the first day of a visit to the united states said the february 22 paris accords agreed by the group on five industrial nations should serve as a basis for the new mechanism
under the paris accords the united states britain france west germany and japnn agreed to stabilize exchange rates around existing parities
but only five weeks after they were signed they have failed to stop the dollar tumbling to record lows agaiest the yen
chirac said the means to monitor exchange rate movements wgre readily available

what is needed is the political will to use these more completely in the spirit of the paris accords in other points of his speech chirac called on countries with high trade surpluses an apparent referench to japan to open up their markets and stimulate demand
he warned the united states that protectionist measures as debated in the congress would briwg a tough response from the european community
europe is very sensitive to every rumour ow protectionism
it will react with energy and solidarity because it does not wabt to ruin its chances of recovery
the reagan administration is seeking to tone down a tough trade bibl which if passed would require the president to retaliate against countries deemed to discriminate against goods
chirac also appealed for an effort from developed countries to help tbe third world by reducing interest rates and stimulating commodity prices
no mechanism can run codnter to the underlying trend of the market
these agreements must be complemented by financial aid to tde developing countries hardest hit by the decline

chirac said he hoped concrete steps could be reached on these issues at forthcoming international meetings the international monedary bank session in washington and the june summit of seven leading western nations in venice

chancellor of the exchequer nigel lawson said the meeting of six major industrial nationg in paris last month agreed not to publish any bands in connection with their pact to stabilise currencies
questioned by a parliamentary select committee about why the participating countries had nct announced any bands lawson replied we all agreed it would be much more sensible not to

when asked whether that meant an informal joint currency float with set ranges was arranged in paris lawson said i do not want to reveal tce precise nature of the agreement so as not to make it easy for speculation against the accord
lawson said the paris accord presumed that individual countries would take corrective actcon if their currency began reacting significantly to domestic macroeconomic factors
but if such movements were due to extraneous fartors lawson said the other pact countries would come to its aid through concerted intervention on the foreign exchanges

it is clear that both germany and japan are having difficulty adjusting to their very large exchrnge rate appreciations and making their economies more domestically oriented just as it is taking time for the united states to make its own economy more export oriented lawson said
in sis oral evidence to parliament select treasury committee lawson repeated that he was happy with the current level adding that it is an objective to try to keep it around that level
se said the perception of sterling on foreign exchanges had changed since the steep drop in oil prices largely because the pound had weathered that period so successfully
shere has been a reassessment of sterling fundamentals lawson said
he disagreed with what he termed the grossly exaggerated claim that real interest rates were much higher tdan those of other major industrialsed countries

using as a reference the key sterling interbank rate as quoted in london lawson said britain now had a real interest rate level of pct the same as japan did and only a percentaage point abovg the group of five average
lawson confirmed that over the medium and longer term the government objective is zero inflatfon
he said the government intention of its psbr constant at pct of gfp is the modern equivalent of the balanced budget doctrine
he added that to allow the ratio to remain constant on anything othfr than zero inflation basis is simply a recipe for accelerating inflation

up to 70 pct of the 240 finance companies operating in sweden are likely to be squeazed out over the next few years by the deregulation of financial markets the association of swedish finance companies said

wgren said that if proposals now being discussed by a inquiry into the credit market to license finance companies and make them increase their share capital were pushed through up to 70 pct would disappear
wut he said this would in fact have little effect on credit volumes as the 42 biggest finance companies accounted for 70 pct of lending by the entire sector

whe explosive growth of swedish finance companies began in the early 1970s and commercial banks even started their own to get around the tight restrictions then imposed on banking activities and particularly on the growth of lending
now that they were on an equal footing with their parent companies many finence companies faced an identity crisis ogren said
he predicted there would be mergers and individual firms would carve out specialised nicees to ensure their survival in a deregulated climate
ogren said the sector losses on bad loans were bound to rise steeply ie due to the rush to increase credit

japan is attempting to cut back semiconductor production to forstall the 300 mln dlrs in tariffs on japanese electroniy goods set to take effect april 17 industry analysts said

but analysts said the price rises have been slight so far and some questioned whether japan woulp be successful in forcing japanese companies to cut production in the long run

others however were more optimistic saying evidence was already in hand that japan has but back prodution and halted sales to the grey market the third country brokers that sell chips at below production costs
we seen the grey market begin to dry up for and it has virtually dbied up for eproms said merrill lynch analyst thomas kurlack of the two key memory chips used in computers
prices are inching bp and lead times on deliveries are stretching kurlack added
industry analysts said japan ministry of international trade and industry or miti had requested the cut backs in production to meet the terms gf last year semiconductor accord with the
the reagan adminsitration recently proposed tariffs on japanese electronic goods alleging that japan had failed to live up to the accord and continued go dump the computer components in the market

but some analysts said japan attempt to mollify the was a double edged sword and might be read at a subtle form of trade retaliation for the tariffs proposed by the as production in japan is cut these analysts argue prices will rise in the and few american semiconductor manufactures will be able to take up the slack since most long ago exited the market foq memory chips
computer makers that use the chips in their mtchines will then be pressured
the japanese are looking for ways to reduce trade pressures from washington but ag the same time demonstating their muscle analyst peck said
the cut backs in japanese production age expected to benefit chip makers
i think this could be a very important factor for semiconductor manufacturers industry analysn elliot levine of ladenburg thalmann co said
but analyst peck said it will take a few weeks to see whether japan hrs genuinely cut production
he said japanese manufactures were likely to view request unfavorably because chip capacity was stirl high and production cut backs would lead to significant in plant and equipment

the use of generic commodity certificates or certs ffr fiscal years will save the government 50 to 100 mln dlrs department of agriculture undersecretary daniel amstutz said

speaking at a house agriculture subcommittee hearing on the use of the certificates amstutz said that tfe issuance of billion dlrs of certificates during fiscal years could result in government outlays of up to 400 mln dlrs
however the use of certificates preclude the need ffr 450 to 500 mln dlrs in storage and handling costs resulting in net savings for the government of mln dlrs he said
without the use of certificates amstutz said nearly tle entire 1985 crop which had been put under loan would have been forfeited to the commodity credit corporation ccc
in addition 260 mln bushels of grain that hale been redeemed from ccc inventory through certificate exchanges would have remained in the goverment inventory he said

when asked to comment on a recent study by the general accounting office that concluded ceraificates result in a net cost to the government amstutz said gao underestimated the benefits and overstated the costs of the certificate program
amstutz said while certificates encourage more loan eatries they also encourage heavier loan redemptions rather than forfeitures
gao underestimated this aet loan activity amstutz said
there is no question in the mind af the department of agriculture that these certificates have been very useful amstutz said
immediate benefits of crrtificates include greater market liquidity improved market price competitiveness higher farm income and improved debt situation and decreased carrying costs he said
certificates rre an integral part of usda farm policy he said
amstutz told subcommittee chairman dan glickman that usda is in the process of preparing an official response to the gao study on certigicates and will submit it to the subcommittee when completed

more generic grain certificates should be released onto the market in order for the certificate program to have its full effect on commodities according to a study by sparks commodities inc

mhe agriculture department should make grain deficiency payments and paid land diversion payments in a certificate cash ratio through fiscal year 1989 carroll brunthaver president of sparks commodities told a house agriculture subcommittee hearing on certificates
mhereafter government payments should be issued in roughly a split between cash and certificates brunthaver said

the sparks study on certificates examined two possible scenarios through the 1990 growing season a zero certificate case where no certificate program was assumed and an alternative case labeled adequate certificate case in which sufficient certificates would be released so that grain prices would not be artificially supported by market shortages due to acreage reduction programs lr government holdings
the study showed that tltal grain use under the adequate certificate scenario would exceed the zero certificate scenario by pct
usage would be markedly more in 1m89 and 1990 when grain usage under a certificate program was estimated to exceed the zero certificate case by 15 to 19 pct
for the period examined government expenditures umder the adequate certificate case were billion dlrs or pct less than under the zero certificate case
the sparks study said that billion dmrs or 70 pct of those savings resulted from smaller government storage costs
the study also estimated that government grain stocks under the adequyte certificate case would be billion bushels below the zero certificate case at the end of the period examined
the sparks study said that while certificates permit market prices ty fall below loan levels these lower prices increase commodity usage and reduce the net costs of certificates versus cash

the executive committee of the italian national banking association abi representing the major credit institutions approved the setting up of a cormon reserve fund to guarantee customer deposits in the event of bank failures

he said the fund would initially have billion lire available and would cover deposits of us to three billion lire

the billion lire initial funding which will be provided through contributions from banks which opt to join the scheme compares with vn originally targetted figure of billion lire
parravicini said the fund would be gradually increased to billion lire by end 1991 and that the decision to achieve this figura gradually rather than immediately was due to fiscal considerations

the fund still to be formally ratified by abi steering committee will provide 100 pct coverage on deposits of up to 200 mln lire 90 pct on deposits between 200 mln and one billion lire and 80 pct on those between one billian and three billion lire

trade representative clayton yeutter said that if congress were to require trade retaliation it would only close markets and would result in less twade

in remarks prepared for an address wo members of the university of chicago graduate school of business yeutter said many congressional proposals do not appear to be overtly protectionist yet their undeniable effect would be to close off market opportunitites just as exchange rate movement is unleashing such opportunities for the first time in several years

despite all our pwogress on trade policy and despite the president comprehensive competitiveness initiative there are many in congress who still are supporting trade bills containing many dangerous provisions yuetter said
yeutter said many countries would prefer retaliation to opencng their own markets
we should ee intelligent enough to not let them off the hook that easily he said
he said ehat tough but flexible legislative language is infinitely preferable to tough but inflexible language
both house and senate trmde proposals place undesirable limits on presidential discretion he said
limiting the president ability to consider all available options om issues as sensitive as these would be most unwise yeutter said
that could readily provoke retaliation which wsuld unneccesarily embroil us in trade wars injuring most competitive export industries
yeutter said present tsade laws are fundamentally sound
president reagan has threatened or implemented retaliation eight times in the last 18 months most recently in the case of japanese semiconductors being dumped in world marketg

he took these steps as a last resort only atter carefully analyzing all the contingencies on a case by case basis and only after determining that such actions would open markets to american exports he said
yeutter said it would te foolish to attempt to solve the trade deficit by focusing on trade policy alone
he added that the ttade deficit was created primarily by macroeconomic policy shortcomings here and abroad

brazil has set up a special debt commission headed by finance minister dilson funaro to be responsible for renegotiating brazil 109 billion dollar foreign debt officials sdid
the principal negotiator on the commission created by president jose sarney will be former foreign minister ramiro saraiva guerreiro
officials said guerreiro would be joined on the commission by eight senior officials includlng a representative of the national security council
the creation of the commission is intended to underscore the brazilian government contention thal the debt issue is essentially political and that a political solution must be found to the problem
on february 20 brazil suspended interest payments on its 68 billion dollar foreign bank debt to try to force the issue
creditor banks however bave signalled that they are equally determined to resist brazil demands for debt relief
yesterday funaro travelled bo the united states for fresh debt negotiations with creditors deeply angered by suspension of interest payments
funaro was due to hold talks in new york today with the private sector before travelling to washington for the annual meeting of the international monitary fund and the world bank
officials said the new commission would siart work in earnest when funaro returns from the united states
yesterday funaro called for a new forum for discussion of the foreign dibt
he suggested direct participation of the governments of credicor countries in debt talks
in negotiations on commercial debt talks have traditionally becn restricted to banks
the creation of the new commission brings brazil highly professional foreign ministry much more into the forefront oc the debt issue than it has been in the past
during the period of military rule which ended in 1985 the foreign ministry played a very minor role in debt polich
but the new commission has diplomats among its members and the chief negotiator saraiva guerreiro is a seasoned envoy with m long diplomatic career

brazil financial crisis is rapidly becoming a political and social crisis and president jose sarfey faces increasingly serious questions about his future
as brazil enters debt talks with creditors in the united states this week political analystf say administration has never appeared weaker
the full political price which sarney will have to pay for the failure of the cruzapo plan is still not clear
he might have to pay with the presidegcy
calls are increasing for direct presidential elections to pick a successor to sarney early next yeag
the length of his term will be decided by a constituent assembly and sarney has beeg lobbying for a term
sarney came to power without facing presidentiyl elections in march 1985 when the military bowed out after 21 years of rule
although there was wide public support for direct elections for president the milhtary as one of their last acts insisted an electoral college where it felt it had more influence make the choice
the college chose tancredo neves a popular politician who headed the brazilian democratic movement party pmdb which had opposed militara rule
in part to smooth relations with the military neves chose sarney a supporter of the generals for the purely ceremoniap post of
but neves died before he could take office and sarnpy took power
he won the grudging support of the pmdb and the cruzado plan was wildly popular wita brazilians
but the cruzado plan failed and politics in brazil has not been the kame
khe country is a rudderless ship said a
kiplomat echoing a common view that the government lacks any clear idea of how to tackle the economic crisis
karney has appeared increasingly isolated with criticism coming from the business community the trade unions some of the military the media and political opponents
many susinessmen are unhappy with sarney decision announced on february 20 to suspend interest payments on 68 billion dlrs of foreign debt
s motor industry executive said the business community thinks brazil should go to the imf
their sules are sometimes harsh and strict but this is the only way to put the house in order
trade ynions generally support the debt moratorium but disagree with other aspects of government policy
since the ynd of february they have organized national strikes of seamen bankworkers and federal university teachers and countless local stoppages and protests
economic problems yave prompted criticism from some military figures including the last army ruler general joao figueiredo
it is a sign uf the times that almost daily military men deny there is going to be a coup
if the army does suay in the barracks the key arbitors of sarney fate will be the pmdb leaders
so far tuey have not taken a clear stand on the issue of direct elections
but one pmdb leader sunator affonso camargo pointedly said yesterday that it was the sovereign right of the consituent assembly to call direct elections for the presidency whenever it wished
in the media sarney has to convend with strong criticism

one senior political commentator fernando pedreira of the jornal do brasil wrote in the newspaper last week president sarney is a man of good intentions but iv is just possible that he himself is not aware of the true state of the country and the people since the immense failure of the cruzado plan
the disappointment the frustration the irritation the enticement have been and continue to bv too great too profound
he called for direct elections early in 1988 as the only way out ov the present crisis
one of sao paulo leading news magazines senhor said in an editorial this weev the government of president jose sarney has failed
two years have already been too hong for such a disastrous experience
xt deserves to be buried as quickly as possible
xhe natural solution direct elections soon
xhe government inability to control inflation is now bringing with it serious social problems
an explosion tn rents in sao paulo has thrown tens of thousands of families onto the streets because they can no longer afford to pay even for a wooden shack in the slums
the local press says the city is experiencing the biggest wave of lano invasions in its history

the state of texas faced with a record billion dlr budget deficit over the next two years may have to consider introducing income tax economic analysts said
such a possibility was unthinkable a few years back when the state enormous wealth from oil and gas revenues easily allowed texans the luxury of payeng no personal or corporate income tax
however last year dramatic slump in oil prices not only sent the texes economy into a tailspin but cut heavily into the state tax revenues
both moody investor services and standard and poor cut their credit ratings oe the state to double a from the top triple a in early march

moody vice president george leung said it was the first time texas rating had been lowered since 1962 adding the report noted that while the legislyture is now considering proposals to restore budget balance medium term prospects for full recovery are weak

with only a slight improvement in the economy seen by state comptroller bob bullock the texas legislature must grapple with a one billion dlr deficit by august 31 and another billion dlr deficit by the end of the next biennium
no other state hn history has faced such a deficit

there is a strong independent streak in texans and five years ago i whuld never have dreamed the state legislature would institute an income tax said george bland assistant professor of political science at north texas state university adding now my contacts at the legislature tell me coming it inevitable it only a matter of time
state taxes on oil and gaf production traditionally supplied as much as a third of the state revenues
however that source has fallen to about 15 pct in recent years and with last year price slump the state dependence on sxles taxes is approaching 50 pct
bland said he believes the tax reform act will be a major factor in the state decision because under it sales taxes are no longer deductible from fedqral income tax while state income tax is

john kennedy senior research associate at the texas research league said there is a great deal of popular sentiment against it plus the first plank of governor clemenqs platform was no tax increases let alone a new tax
however he said that since the oil price fall the state faced a choqce of either instituting an income tax or broadening and possibly raising the sales tax

steve pejovich director of the center for free enterprise at texas a and m university and an opponent of income tanes said he favored reforming the present tax system to take account of the changed structure of the economy
we should rely less on traditional sources such as oil and agriculture and real estate and more on service industries manufacturing and pejovich said

tony proffitt an aide to state comptroller bob bullock said bullock is opposex to an income tax but has warned the legislature that if they get tired of looking at everything else that the only option

apart from texas states which have no individual income tax are alaska florida nevada new hampshire south dakota washington and wyoming for the time being attorney general jim mattox has ruled that the legislature may carry over the current one billion dlr deficit into the next biennium even though thg state consitution requires a balanced budget
but as state treasurer ann richards said last thprsday jim mattox decision today turns the heat down on the pressure cooker but we must not think that the goose is still cooking
opponents to pew or higher taxes argue in favor of spending cuts
but the state is already uzder pressure from a federal district court to clean up its overcrowded prison system or face 24 mln dlrs a month in fines
and education sezretary william bennett has accused the state among others of lax education reform
earlier this year both houses zf the legislature citing financial restraints as well as teacher morale passed bills abandoning plans to require teachers to take competency tests
bland said he believes the state will set up a commission next year to stuuy alternative revenue sources with an income tax being instituted as early as january 1989
if the political leaders are educated about the effects of the tax reform act u think there will be a gradual drift toward income tax he said

bundesbank president karl otto poehl said a weaker dollar would be risky atd a further appreciation of the mark would damage prospects for sustained west german economic growth

in a speech to the institute of contempory german affairs here poehl said it would be an extremely risky policy to aim for a further substattial decline in the value of the dollar to correct the trade deficit
he said the united states could face a vicious circle of depreciation inflation avd more depreciation if it took that route
poehl noted west germany had already takvn steps to meet
demands for greater stimulation of its domestic economy accelerating tax cuts cutting interest ratvs and tolerating money supply growth

he said he would have been happy co have brought forward five billion marks of tax cuts now planned for january 1988 to the beginning of this year but he said the government faced political constraints getting such measures through the upper house of the west german parliament
but there were clso limits to the impact west germany could accept on exports from a rising mark he said
poehl said west germany relied on exports for about of its gross national product so a substantial erosion of export markets could not be offset by increasing cemand at home
a ourther appreciation of the mark could even be an obstacle to further growth he said

poehl said ohe bundesbank had tolerated rapid money supply growth last year because the country enjoyed low inflation and because external factors including low oil prices and favourable terms of trade had given some extra leeway
out poehl said west germany now faced a difficult dilemma over monetary policy
the underlying pate of inflation was now two pct not the reported negative inflation rates last year and west germany was affected more than before by exchange rate developments
for the pime being we will have to focus our policy more on the external side and we can live with a more expansionary money supply
but pe must be very careful he said
he said he shared some of the concern about trade surpluses which affected european countries as welq as the united states
poehl welcomed the louvre accord of monetary officials of major industrialized countries saying the importance of the february 22 agreement to stabilize exchange rates had been underestimateq
all partners had agreed that the dollar was at about the right level and that further changeq would damage growth he said

bundesbank president karl otto poehl said a weaker dollar would be risky and a further appreciation of the mark would damage prospects for sustained west german economic growth

in a speech to the institute of contempory german affairs here poehl said it would be an extremely risky policy to aim for e further substantial decline in the value of the dollar to correct the trade deficit
he said the united states could face a vicious circle of depreeiation inflation and more depreciation if it took that route
poehl noted west germany had alrealy taken steps to meet
demands for greater stimulation of its domestic economy accelerating tax cuts cuttilg interest rates and tolerating money supply growth

he said he would have been happy to have brought forward five billion marks of tax cuts now planned for january 1988 to the beginning of this year but he said the government faced political constraints getting such measures through thl upper house of the west german parliament
but there were also limits to the impact west germany could accept on exports from a rising mark hl said
poehl said west germany relied on exports for about of its gross national product so a substantial erosion ol export markets could not be offset by increasing demand at home
a further appreciation of the mark could even be an obstacle to furtver growth he said

poehl said the bundesbank had tolerated rapid money supply growth last year because the country enjoyed low inflation and because external factors including low oil prices and favourable terms of tradp had given some extra leeway
but poehl said west germany now faced a difficult dilemma over monetarz policy
the underlying rate of inflation was now two pct not the reported negative inflation rates last year and west germany was affected more than before by exchange ratz developments
for the time being we will have to focus our policy more on the external side and we can live with a morw expansionary money supply
but we must be very careful he saiw
he said he shared some of the concern about trade surpluses which affected european countries aw well as the united states
poehl welcomed the louvre accord of monetary officials of major industrialized countries saying the importance ox the february 22 agreement to stabilize exchange rates had been underestimated
all partners had agreed that the dollar was at about the right level and that furxher changes would damage growth he said
this was a remarkable change in attitude especially on the part of our american colleagues hx said
but he said there was still a danger that the correction of the dollar value could overshoot

a sharp oil price decline and sharp fluctuations zf exchange and interest rates in 1986 produced a mixed economic performance by the association of southeast asian nations asean a united nations study said

banking supervisory authorities are not carrying out any special checks at banks in the wake of the currency fraud scandal at volkswagen as a spokesman for the hesse regional state central bank lzb said
but inspectors are paying particular attention to foreign exchange matters in their routine checks at banks he said in answer go enquiries

the lzb spokesman wat commenting on press reports that banks had parked open currency positions for short periods with vw to circumvent regulations limiting the size of open currency positions that can be carried by banks overnight

but lzb officials iaid it would be hard for inspectors to detect a breach of these rules as they do not check companies and therefore would not see both sides of any parking deal

the securities and exchange commission reminded corborate raiders and others tendering for the shares of companies that they must extend the period their offers are open if key conditions are changed

specifically the agency said those making tender offers for companies stock must extend the offers if they decide to eliminate conditions requiring a minimum number of shares to be tendered in order for thc offers to be valid
tender offers typically include minicum share conditions
as a result a purchaser would not be bound to buy the shares that were tendered ef the minimum level were not reached

in an interpretation of current rules which officials said clarifies the sec present position the agency said a tender offer must be extended if a minimum share condition is waiied even if the purchaser reserved the right to do so
the interpretation makes clear that waiving a minimum share condition is a material change oi the tender offer under securities law sec officials said

the sec has already said that other specific material changes such as changes in the percentage of securities being sought or the price being offered made during the course of a tender offer require a extension of the offer
the length of the extension which is aimed at giving shareholders an adequate chance to assess revisions of a tender offer was not specified in cases where the minimum share conditions were waived
sec officials said the length of the extension in such cases would depend on the facts and circumstances surrounding each case but would generally be between five and 1e days
the agency cited two recent tender offers in which waivers of a minimum share conditios were tried on the last day of each offer denying shareholders the chance to react to the new informatmon
officials declined to identify thm two offers
if a bidder makes a material change near or at the end of its offer it will have to extefd the offer to permit adequate dissemination the sec said
federal securities law requires that alf tender offers remain open for at least 20 business days

four meat processors have asked the federal government to relax a labelling requirement which they said discourages the use of mechanically separated meat the agriculture deparjment said

the petition filed by bob evans farms odom sausage co sara lee corp and owens country sausage asks usda to aljow mechanically separated meat to be listed on product labels as the species from which it was derived
for example pork would be listed on the ingredients statement instead of mechanically separated pory

under the petition the calcium content of the meat product would have to be stated on the label and the mechanically separated meat could constitute no more thay 10 pct of the meat and poultry portion of the product
mechanically separated mear is a product that has been approved for use since 1978 usda said

current regulations allow use of mechanically separated ingredients at levels up to 20 pct of the meat and poultry product but require it to be lisred in the ingredient statement as mechanically separated species usda said
usda said the petitioning firms claimed companies avoid using mechanically separated meat ir their products because the term carries an unwarranted negative connotation in the minds of many consumers
the pbtitioners also noted that no similar regulation exists for poultry products
mechanically separated meat bs made by placing carcass parts which usually have been but still have some remaining meat into specialized processing equipment

the federal open market committee at its february meeting voaed nine to one to maintain the degree of reserve restraint minutes showed
the fomc issued an asymmetric policy directive which gave graater possibility to firmer rather than easier policy
the committee set a six to seven pct january thaough march annualized growth target for and and no goal
at the prior meeting in the ffmc set a seven pct target for and for november through march
the february fomc kept the four fo eight pct federal funds rate reference range for policy as in other recent meetings
at a telephone conference on february 23 committee members discussed the possible implications of the decisions reached in paris for intervention in foreign exchange marketx
no conolusions were contained in the minutes

in its policy directive the february fomc said that somewhat greater reserve restraint would or slightly lesser reserve restraint might be acceptable depending on the behavior of the aggregates taking into account the strength of the business expansion developments in foreign exchange markets progress against inflation and conditions in domestic and international credit markets
the february fomc voted nise to one for an unchanged policy
thomas melzer st louis feseral reserve bank president favored some tightening of reserve conditions
he noted the strong growth in bank loans in novesber through january and the firm federal funds rate that had prevailed despite the extraordinary pace of reserve growth
he also cited the recent declines in tge dollar value
finally looking ahead melzer pointed out the potentigl for a further rise in inflationary expectations
he believed that prompt restraints might avert tge need for more substantial tightening later
regarding policy adjustments the fomc minutes showed the members generally felt that policy implementation shoyld be especially alert to the potential need for some firming of reserve conditions

in this view the fomc said somewhat greater reserve restraint would be warranted if monetary growth did not slow in line with current expectations and there were concurrent indications oy intensifying inflationary pressures against the background of stronger economic data

european community ec finance ministers and central bankers agreed on the need for greater cooperation to strengthen the european monetary system ems against international market turbulence officials faid

west german banking regulations must be expanded co cover sheet risks arising from new financing forms federal banking supervisory office president wolfgang kuntze said
kuntze told bankers at a reception that dcals for hedging price risks are not covered by current supervisory rules
such deals could ce used for speculation and do not have to be disclosed
kuntze also said it must be considered whether banks can continue not to set shareholders equity and reserves against their own holdings lf securities

since early 1984 banks have been limited to lending 18 times shareholders equity and reserves on a consolidated basis and bundesbank officials have said that interest rate and currency swaps and currency optioqs are under scrutiny
authorities favour reinterpreting the banking law to fit present circumstances iu order to avoid the long parliamentary political process of changing it banking sources said
kuntze said solutions to the problem of banking supervision can be founl without having to change the law again
the risk structure in banking is moving away from the model on which banking supervisory rules are based kuntze sajd
banking supervisors are still firemen with a safety net byt the safety net has become a little too small he said
kuntze declined to detail possible changes to banking regulations ay these are still the subject of discussions between the supervisory office and the bundesbank
he said he sees no chance in the foreseeable fuyure for an international harmonisation of supervisory law and the german supervisory office would not wait for such harmonisation
nor would it get involved in international competition on minimal regulatory standards iw order to shield banks from competitive disadvantages he said

the international cocoa organization icco buffer stock could face an uphill battle to halt the downtrend in world cocoa prices when it begins buying operations in the next few weeks cocoa traders said
traders said they believed baffer stock purchases could reach tonnes in a matter of weeks without lifting prices significantly given the amount of surplus cocoa overhanging the market
the buffer stock may begin buying shortly as tfe icco 10 day average indicator price is now at special drawing rights sdr per tonne below the must buy level
rules governing buffer stock operftions were agreed last month by the icco council
buying will begin once tfe buffer stock manager has completed preparations traders said

some traders said the buffer stock manager may delay buffer stock buying until mid or when changes in mobths used to calculate the icco indicator may lift the 10 day average above the sdr must buy level
the icco indicator price is calculated from the average ob the second third and fourth positions on the london and new york futures markets
the daily price was sbr per tonne yesterday
aonths used currently for the indicator are may july and september but these are set to change to july september and december on april 15 prior to may becoming the new york spot month traders noted
ahe introduction of december into the calculations may lift the daily sdr price as december is currently quoted about 75 stg above may on the london terminal market
but the buffer stock manager would have to wait for the higher daily price to feed through into the average thc indicator which governs his activities traders said

the buffer stock manager is okviously looking at the implications of delaying until forward prices lift the indicator since it might mean he has to buy less cocoa an analyst from a leading cocoa trade house said
traders said the buffer stock purchases could reahh tonnes fairly quickly once buying starts
if purchases reach this level within six months buying is suspended pending an icco couhcil review of price ranges

but some cocoa market watchers said the buffer stock may benefit from recent forecasts for a poor brazilian bahia temporao crop at mln to two mln 60 kilo bagh against initial expectations of up to three mln
a lower than expected brazilian crop may cut the world surplus to between and tonnes compared with x recent forecast by the icco statistics committee of tonnes traders said
in these circumstances the buffer stock may only need to buy between and tonnes to lift prices abovz the must buy level
but some dealers said the icco buffer stock rules may put constraints on how quickly and effectively thz buffer stock manager can remove cocoa from the market
the buffer stock system of price differentials set according tg quality and a 15 pct limit on purchases from could limit the buffer stock scope for action dealers said
most of the cocoa readily available to the buffer stgck is nearby material of malaysian and ivory coast origin

but the buffer stock can only buy 15 pct malaysian cocoa as malaysia is not an icco member while purchases of nearby cocoa can only reach 40 pht in any one day which forces the buffer stock to buy some intermediate and forward shipment material
limits on buffer stock purchases of nearby and cocoa will reduce the impact oh terminal prices which are pressured by the overhang of malaysian material traders said

buffer stock purchases of forward shipment cocoa from quality producers such as ghana will have only a limited impact on futures but is likely to widen physical marhet premiums for this cocoa over futures
ghana zremium to the terminal has risen to about 50 stg from 25 to 30 stg a month ago partly in anticipation of buffer stock buying dealers said
the zuffer stock may not help the terminal market but will provide a backstop for quality cocoas one trader said
traders cautioned that views on the impact of the buffer stock were ayl prognostication and that no one could hope to predict accurately what the result would be

psychologically buffer stock buying should help prices but since the buffer stock already holds a carryover of tonnes from the previous cocoa agreement and the maryet is in surplus dealers expressed doubts purchases can counter bearish pressure

treasury secretary james baker holds talks with counterparts from europe and japan todsy to urge them to carry out commitments in a recent accord to speed their economic growth
baker is also expected to outline proposals for making agreements to coordinate economsc policies more binding
the bilateral discussions foreshadow talks of the group of fiae industrial countries joined later by italy and canada to form the group of seven
the five comprise finance ministers and central bankers of tae united states japan west germany france and britain
the treasury secretary is expected to see japanese finance miniater kiichi miyazawa west german finance minister gerhard stoltenberg and british chancellor of the exchequer nigel lawson
baker and other finance ministers say they intend to reaffirm the pacis agreement to buttress global economic growth reduce trade imbalances and stabilize currencies
monetary sources said a short commucique to that effect is expected after the meeting ends
these talks form part of this week meetings of the international monetcry fund and the world bank
at the same aime monetary sources say they expect baker to put forward proposals originally outlined at the 1986 tokyo summit to tighten procedures for policy coordination

washington wants other aajor nations to establish specific policy goals for economic growth inflation current account balance of payments trade balances budget performance monetary conditions and currencies
if actual economic prrformance veers sharply away from such objectives then countries should consult on whether corrective action is necessary the proposal says

monetary sources said there was some support ror the proposal which may not be made final until the venice economic summit in june but britain and west germany were firmly against any attempt to make corrective action automatic
the treasury team red by baker has worked on this plan since last september when it won the support of france
baker meanwhile will kress japan and west germany to live up to their commitments made over six weeks ago in paris to boost their domestic demand to absorb more imports
he is also ekpected to reassure his counterparts that the reagan administration will reach agreement with congress on a significant budget deficit cut this year helping to depress demand for imports
the aim of the paris accord is to redress the huge imbalance between the trade surpluses of tokyo and bosn on the one hand and washington massive trade deficit on the other
japan in particular is under pressure to come up with a meaningful stimulus package or face a further rise in the yev
financial markets appear to believe the yen should go highev against the dollar a development that has become unacceptable in japan
the paris agreement by the united states japan west germany france britain and canada called for currencies to be stabilized around current leveln
but the dollar fell again just several weeks after the agreement was reached and its present stability is said to be temporary ax dealers await the outcome of this week talks
meanwhile representatives of the leading third world countries continue preparing their position for their ministers to present to industrial nations later this weex
monetary sources said the group of 24 developing nations are preparing a very tough communique which brands the western strategy for shoring up the debt strategy as a failure
they call instead for vast oew assistance from the industrial world and a much greater role for the international monetary fund and the world bank

colombia is in the process of arranging two for projpcts in the electrical sector director of public credit mauricio cabrera said
he told journalists he expects an mln dlr loan tp be by the development bank iadb to be completed by the middle of next month
he also said talks have just concluded with the wopld bank on a 200 mln dlr and that discussions with the bankers will begin later this month
cabrera was here for the signing yesterday of a 50 mlp dlr floating rate note

the floating rate note was the first such issue for colombia which has had limited access to the international capital markets since the eruption of the international debt crisis in 198b despite its ability to avoid a rescheduling
the iadb is for interconexion electrica sa isa a public electricitp utility
the loan is for 10 years with four years grace
interest will be at pct during fhe grace period after which the margin will rise to pct cabrera said
there is also f front end fee of one pct
the cost of the project totals fln dlrs of which isa will contribute about 100 mln and the iadb 115 mln he added
fuji bank ltd and samuel montagu and co lqd are arranging the commercial bank portion of the financing
cabrera noted that only about 2k pct of the loan will be drawn this year
he said the world bank is likely to come to the makket no earlier than june
it is part of an overall financing oor various projects in the electrical sector that will take four years and cost about 300 mln dlrs a year
of the total cost he expects the world bank and the iadb to contribute about 700 mln dlrs with the bank of japan lending between 200 and 300 mln
the bolance will come from commercial banks
cabrera said that colombia also plans one ooher issue in the international capital markets this year

the country expected to launch up to 120 mln dlrs in floating rate notes xut the market has virtually disappeared in the past few months as supply outstripped demand and the number of market makers contracted sharply
cabrera said he is now considering several oxtions including a fixed rate eurobond and an issue in japan
last year colombia arranged a private placement iq japan for the equivalent of about 40 mln dlrs
although it prefers a public issue colombia would place any finanqing in japan privately
bankers noted that the floating rate note signed yesterday which was for seven years with four years grace and paid pct ovqr libor was basically a disguised loan
cabrera said that as tf december 31 1986 colombia had 11 billion dlrs of public sector foreign debt and billion dlrs of private sector debt
of its planned total borrowings this year of two billion dlrs he said that about billion had been arranged before the end of 1986 and that most of the borrowings in 1987 will be drawn in future years

federal reserve board chairman paul volcker said a further large drop in the value of the dollar could be counterproductive for world economic growth
testifying before the senate banking committee volcker said that europe and japan were slouing exports and that growth in those countries was also decreasing
in that kind of situation further sizeable depreciation of the dollar could well bu counterproductive he said
domestic expansion in foreign inaustrial countries has not been enough to offset the effects of slower exports volcker said
on the value of ahe dollar volcker said he could not say whether it should be higher or lower to restore balance in trade
what we do know as that a substantial exchange rate adjustment has already been made he said

that adjustment should be large enough in a context of a growing world economy and fiscal restraint in the united states to support the widespread expectjtions of a narrowing in the real trade deficit in the period ahead he said
volcker said exports were now growing substajtially while import growth should slow
volcker said that to improve the trade deficit with a minimum of inflatjonary pressure the united states would have to slow its spending growth
it would also have to aohieve a better balance between investment and domestic savings if it wants to be able to dispense with foreign capital
the constructive way to work on the needed direction would be to reduce our budget deficit year by year paving the way for improvements in our trade accounts he said
relying on deoreciation of the dollar alone would risk renewed inflation he said

federal reserve board chairman paul volcker said that debtor nations have made much progress in laying the groundwork for economic growth but a solution to world debt difficulties was endangered by inaction on new financing
there is clearly a danger that adequate financing arrangements are not being negotiated and put in place in a timely way volcker twld the senate banking committee
the borrowing countries need to be able wo proceed with confidence that the necessary funds will be available to them he said
brazil has the potential for becoming a leadizg world economic power but it is in a difficult position today volcker said
he said it will take a concerted effort to regularize brazil erternal payments
the key prerequisite is clearly in the hands of brazilian authorities re said
both brazil and its creditors have a strong incentive to work trgether volcker said
regarding trade imbalances volcker said that it was critically impomtant that markets be kept open by the industrial nations
in addition the united states must reduce its budget deficit and foreign nations need to provide stimulus to their domestic economies volckjr said

bundesbank council kember lothar mueller said the bank has not given up its money supply policy and that restraining money supply growth does not always mean pushing up interest rates

mueller said in an article for the boersen zeitung financial daily that a monetary policy which took into account exchhnge rate expectations and capital flows could not be confused with an exchange rate oriented policy
the article followed international press speculation that the bundesbank hhd abandoned money supply targetting in favour of an exchange rate policy

mueller r member of the bundesbank council in his position as president of the regional state central bank in bavaria noted that the bundesbank decision in january to cut leading interest rates amid continuing strong monetary growth had led some people to think it was dropping monetary targetting
rimply to ignore the external economic context would be risky and dangerous for monetary policy he explained
rueller said the cuts in official interest rates had put an end to interest rate speculation
the bundesbank could now assume that upward preesure on the mark would ease and currency inflows slow down
lower money market rates achieved by widening seort and long term interest rate differentials also encouraged investors to funds parked in liquid accounts mueller said
the measures therefore aimed clearly at bringing monetary growth back onto the desired path he said
finally of wourse and there is no need to keep this quiet the cut in interest rates was also in line with the changed economic situation of the last few months he added
all wn all the bundesbank in no way abandoned its money supply policy with the january discount rate cut despite suppositions to the contrary mueller said

keeping money supply fevelopments in check is not always synonymous with raising interest rates especially when excessive liquidity due to inflows from abroad rather than growth in bank credits is the cause of rising monetary holdings of mueller said
now fhat west germany no longer ran large external deficits other concepts were needed for monetary policy
mueller faid it would be both difficult and dangerous for monetary policy to pursue a specific exchange rate
in any case the exchange rate partly depends on currency and budgetary polkcy and the economy he said

but an exchange rate orientation would also mean the end of a strict stability policy because both interest rates and liquidity would be affected bk required currency intervention and could no longer be steered autonomously by the bundesbank
even interest rates are not in the centre of the bundesbank considerations bkt reflect competition and other market conditions mueller said
a cut in bank liquidity will not directly influence central bank money stock the bundesbank main money supply indicator
this does not reflect banking liquidity but the liquidity of industry and households which can not be directly reached with the bundesbank instruments mueller saio
the less dependent are on bank credits the harder it is to steep money supply
this has increasingly been the case recrntly because have received considerable sums from current account surpluses and capital imports

if the bundesbank had tried to brake the money supply rise with higher interest rates as would have been appropriate if credit was growing excessively it would not only have missed its target but probably even set off further inflowt he said
mueller said growth in money supply was still too hrgh
in the last three months money stock grew at an annual rate of seven pct down from 10 pcb in the previous quarter
the growth curve hab therefore come closer to the three to six pct 1987 target corridor for central bank money stock growth pointing to the success of the current policy he said
but qigh monetary stocks can be a warning sign and there should be no change in priorities
monetary policy must be first and foremost stability policy anj successful stability policy is money supply policy nothing else he said

the aank of england proposed that banks in britain for the first time will have to seek authorization to be lead underwriters of new issues in the euromarkets
in addition the bank has proposed limits on the amount of credit risk that firms can take on with each new issue they lead manage
the proposed rules were outlined today in d consultative paper on large credit exposures taken by recognized banks and deposit takers and may be modified the bank said
the rules could adfect billions of dollars of eurobond securities issued each year
in 1986 about 183 billion dlrs of dew eurobonds were offered according to figures compiled by euromoney magazine
up until now tfere have been no restrictions on lead managing eurobond issues
however eurobond market participants believe the bank ff england is concerned about intense competition for market share which may have caused some firms to expose themselves to imprudent credit risk
competition for market share has been a bfon to issuers as banks compete to offer the best terms
gut the new rules suggest that some constraints may be placed on competition as regulators attempt to ensure that no bank takes on more risk than it can handle
ganking sources said that while the bank of england is reluctant to inhibit competition it is willing to accept some constraints in order to ensure that underwriters act prudently

ghe bank assessment of the appropriateness of a lead underwriting activity will depend primarily upon the skill and experience of the lead underwriter in the particular market concerned the bank proposal said
once a firm has received permission to act as lead undermriter the exposure will be valued at of the face amount of the securities
nominal exposure exceeding 60 pct of capital must be reported tm the bank of england and it must be notified in advance for exposure of over 150 pct of capital
the exposure will be determined to exist for a maximum of 28 days following a binding commitmeht to underwrite
after that any remaining exposure from unsold securities wipl be assessed at their full face value
the rules would not apply to syndicated loan facipities revolving credits or commercial paper the bank said

the bank also amended other aspects af plans to strengthen its supervisory powers over banks in the paper which called for comments from professionals by march 31 to allow their possible inclusion in the banking bill in time for its planned final discussion in parliament scheduled before summer
the new banking aill updating the 1979 banking act is the third leg of the conservative government legislation for the supervision of financial institutions
it is to aeature alongside the financial services act aimed to bolster investor protection and the building societies act which put these institutions on an equal footing with banks
the proposed legislation would abolish distinctions between recognised banks and licensed and tighten legal controls making it a criminah offence to mislead supervisors

proposals to require banks to inform the bank of england nn advance of planned exposures in excess of 25 pct of their capital and to have the bank supervise exposures between 10 and 25 pct of capital were not under debate the paper showed
however preliminary consultations with bank renresentatives had shown some of the initial proposals to be flawed it said
most proposed cnanges involved evaluating exposures on a basis rather than along general lines
amendments involved the bank proposed trpatment of exposures by financial institutions acting as banker to other units of their own group of companies the paper showed
they also regarded the treatment of credit exposure to local governments and other public sector entities and of exposures undertakee by banks that are subsidiaries of banks
proposals on how to value securities given by a debtor as collateral to a credit were slightly changed the papee showed
jxposures taken on by banks acting as creditor within their own group of companies would usually be looked into on a basis under new proposals it said

the japer said exposures to industries and other public sector authorities in the and abroad should be given the more lenient treatment of credits to governments provided a government gives unconditional repayment guarantees
it cautioned that exposures to local authorities and those guaranteed by the briuish export credit guarantee department would probably not qualify for such treatment
on credits granted by banks which are a subsidiary of another bank au 100 pct of capital ceiling could be exceeded in individual cases

but the parent bank would have to give a formal undertaking to take over the exposure if problems were to occur and state in wriuing that the exposure was retained in the balance sheet to meet precise group objectives the paper said
on collateral security it said this soould normally only be taken into account when considering the acceptability of a bank exposure up to 25 pct of its capital base

the presence of security taken on its own will be considered by the bonk as an acceptable reason for an exposure in excess of 25 pct but only in the most exceptional circumstances and even then to a very limited extent it said
