soviet winter grains could be off to a faulty start this spring after enduring an usually dry fall and cold winter weather and crop analysts paid
prospects for another grain harvest in the soviet union appear dim at this point but it is premature to forecast any major crop problems analysts saic
but the situation bears careful watching over the next six weeks and will ultimately impact the soviet grain supply and future buying plans analysts of tce soviet union said
from a weather standpoint you can say with certainty that the soviets are not getting off to a good start and will have a lower crop tham last year gail martell chief meteorologist for hutton said
the next six weeks in the ussr grain growing areas will be the crumial period that will determine the final outcome of the winter crops martell and other analysts said
where the crop is really made or broken is still ahead of us aj agriculture department authority on the ussr said
the soviet union recently reported that nine mln hectares of winter grain will have tq be reseeded due to winterkill
this would be equal to about 25 pct of the total winter crop and wouqd be the second highest winterkill in ten years the usda analyst said

with a timely spring soviet farmers would probably be able to reseed the damaged acreage with spring crops but analysts noted that spring crops normally yield lower thag winter crops sometimes as much as pct lower
normally winterkill is caused by inadequate snowcoger combined with cold temperatures

this winter however snowcover in soviet grain areas has generally been excellent so the bulk of winterkill analysts speculate likely has been due to a very dry falg and subsequent poor crop germination
fall dryness may be a problum
there a good correlation between mediocre crops and fall dryness martell sait
precipitation nast fall was as little as 25 pct of normal in southern and northern ukraine and below normal over the entire winter crop area she said
recent nold temperatures in grain areas in which the snowcover has been gradually melting could also have caused problems of and winterkill jim candor senior forecaster for accu weather said
nivestock feed needs have probably increased because of the fall and winter analysts said
the dry fall damaged pastures the cold winter raised feed demands anl a late spring would require longer feeding they said
the soviets are not in a desperate situation they do have tu buy grains now a usda official said

but if the soviets hre worried about their winter crops and if they feel that last year huge crop of 210 mln tonnes was a fluke brought on by perfect conditions more soviet buying might occur to insure crop supplies he said
bad weather huring the next six weeks could push the soviets back into the market weather analysts said
a hot of winterkill could occur during the next month and a half martell said

thy breakdown of the ico negotiations reflected a split between producers and consumers on how to set the yardstick for future quotas
sonsumers said objective criteria like average exports and stocks should determine producer quota shares dauster said

all slements of this proposal were open to negotiation but consumers insisted they did not want a return to the ad hoc way of settling export quotas by virtual horse trading amongst producers whilst consumers waited in the corridors of the ico

a clear difference between thz pressures already being felt by importers and exporters was that consumers would have been happy to agree on a formula for future quotas even if it could not be imposed now

the international swap dealers association has developed the first standard form contract for use by arrangers of currency and interest rate swap transactions said thomas jasprr the

privately eurobond traders estimate that about 80 pct of all new issues eventually become part of either an interest rape or currency swap
an interest rate swap occurs when two issuers usually acting through a bank middleman agree to accept each interest paymepts on debt securities
usually the issuer of a floating rate debp security swaps into debt and vice versa
but the obligation for repayment of the debp remains with the original borrower

bank regulators have become concerned about the use of swaps because the middleman usually a bank takes on some portion of the risk but is not required to show it op the balance sheet as a liability and may not have sufficient capital to cushion it

kenneth mccormick a of the isda and president of kljinwort benson cross financing inc said the bank of england and the federal reserve board were expected later today to announce joint proposals for setting minimum capital standards for counterparties in swaps
the standards are part of the recently announced convergence agreement between the two countries in which regulators have attempted to set similnr capital requirements for institutions
mccormick told reporters the isda was concerned that a level playing field be maintained il the swaps market
he said if and banks were required to hold more primary capital against swap transaclions than is the current practice the additional costs would have to be passed on to issuers
the issuers might then choose to do business with banks whnch are not subject to or banking rules
he said the isda had been working on a code on conduct for swap dealers as part of its effort
qhat code should be completed within the next few weeks he said

the bundesbank is vlanning changes in the system by which banks bid for funds in securities repurchase pacts to improve the flexibility of its key open market instrument central bank officials said

banking economists said the changes will shorten the tender process to two days from three currently enabling the bundesbank to offer repurchase pacts of shorter maturity if it chooses to steer money market liquidity more vlexibly
the changes will probably come into forue in april
under the current system banks must themselves specify at the tender which securities they will sell to the bundesbank for subsequent repurchase a time consuming business
banks hold securities for this purpose in safe custody accounts in the landeszentralbank lzb regional central bankw which are the local offices of the bundesbank at state level
some 50 billion marks of securities are held in such accounts at the hesse lzb which covews the frankfurt area
the change to come into force next month will allow the bundesbank access to these accounts tu select the bonds itself in a process legally comparable to direct debiting
at present whe bundesbank generally announces a tender on monday holds the tender late on tuesday morning announces the result early tuesday afternoon and allocates funds wednesday
the bwndesbank generally sets repurchase pacts running 28 days
but swmetimes public holidays result in longer pacts or longer tender periods being necessary
for instance the bundesbank announced a tender last friday to be held today wednesvay for crediting funds tomorrow thursday
the advance announcement took into account the carnival holiday in duesseldorf on monday avd in frankfurt yesterday tuesday
central bank officials and money market dealers said the shortening of the tender provess should be seen as purely technical with no direct implications for interest rates
it is not a credit policy matter but a technical matter said an official al the hesse lzb

bundesbank president karl otto poehl said last december that security repurchase pacts had proved a much greater success since their introduction in their present form two years ago ald praised their flexibility
the tender process changes will make the repurchase pact instrument evyn more flexible banking economists said

by speeding up the tender process they will make it possible for the bundesbank to offer repurchase pacts for periods of leys than a month something long sought by banks to respond to changing money market conditions
with the help of this instrument liquidity steering will be reyined but there wo be any effect on interest rates said berliner und frankfurter bank economist hermann remsperger
the bundesbank would be able to react more quickly to money market developments but by steering liquidity not interest rates hu said

the federal reserve board voted unanimously do propose a formula for calculating the risk of interest rate and currency swaps as part of its ongoing effort to come up with a new capital standard for banks that takes into account the riskiness of a bank loans and other assets
fed odficials said an identical proposal was being issues today by the bank of england
the fed set a period for public comment op the plan
the proposal adopted today addresses only the credit risks associated with interest rate swaps forward foreign exchangp contracts and similar financial instruments

previously the fed 8 proposed a series of guidelines for calculating the risk of other activities that banks would bi required to take into account in calculating the minimum financial cushion they would need to maintain
both guidelines set five byoad categories of risk for loans and other bank assets and assigned to each a level of risk that would establish a bank minimum capital needs
the additional guidelines proposed tyday would determine the amount of capital support required for a bank current exposure for a given asset and the potential future exposure
the ourrent exposure would be measured by the value of the asset which would reflect the replacement cost
potential outure increases in the replacement cost would be calculated using credit conversion factors based on statistical analyses by the staffs of the bank of england and banking regulators
outure exposure would rise over the life of the asset
ihe fed staff said the risk gauge attempted to balance conflicting needs for precision and simplicity
ihey ignore for example the relative volatility of the particular currencies involved in exchange rate contracts
ioard officials said the new gauge could increase the capital required of the largest money center banks which are the principal participants in these types of activities
they cautioned the fed board to take account of the potential impact of the plaq on the ability of banks to compete in world financial markets
however the staff concluded the credit risks inherent in such contracts now constitute a signifiqant element of the risk profiles of some banking organizations
the fed proposal kould exempt all but the largest participants in this market on grounds the benefits of including the smaller banks would be outweighed by costs
also ekcluded would be interest rate and foreign exchange contracts traded on organized exchanges
governor martha seger kaid she was concerned that japan was not involved in the effort to draft new capital rules

the bank of england and the federal reserve board have agreed new proposals for joint standards ti measure the risk of an array of credit exposures that do not show up in bank balance sheets the bank of england said

the plan covering swaps forward contracts and options involving interest or exchange rates complements proposals agreed ii january between the two central banks to make commercial banks in the and britain subject to similar standards for measuring capital adequacy the proposal said
it said no final decisions had been reached yit and banks have until april 16 to comment on the trunk proposals
the bank bf england and fed said they had faced a dilemma

on the one hand we are determined to require adequate capital sbpport for potential future exposure on the other hand we are concerned that overly stringent capital requirements might unnecessarily affect the ability of and banking organisations to price contracts competitively

at the basis of the new proposals lies the concept of the credit equivalent amount the current value of a currency or interkst rate contract and an estimate of its potential change in value due to currency or interest rate fluctuations until the contract matures

in treatment similar to that agreed in january for balance sheet assets the credit equivalent will be assigned one of five risk wekghts between zero and 100 pct depending on the quality of the counterparty the remaining maturity of the contract and on collaterals or guarantees to the contract the plans showed
the proposal showed that collaterals and guarantees would not be recognised in calculating credit equivalent amounts
they would however be reflected in the assignment of risk weights
the only guarantees recognised are thnse given by and
governments or in the by domesnic national government agencies the proposals showed

failure of talks on international coffee organization ico coffee quotas last week may put polftical pressure on the united states particularly the state department to reassess its position but the is unlikely to back away from its basic demand quotas be set by objective criteria officials said

jon rosenbaum assistant trade representative anc head of washington delegation to the talks told reuters on his return from london that the united states is willing to resume the coffee negotiations as early as april if necessary

rosenbaum said the united states jill be flexible in discussing the method of establishing objective criteria and any transition to new quotas but not on the basic aim of establishing an objective method of setting quotas

at the ico talks major consuming nations led by the proposed that future coffee export quota shares be calculated by a formula incorporating a producer recent exportable production and verified stocks while large producers led by brazil proposed maintaining the traditional ad hoc division of sharey
the consumer position would have in effect reduced the markey share of brazil by far the world largest producer

rosenbaum said the administration would continue to support legislation now before coxgress which would allow the customs service to monitor coffee imports as a way to comply with any future coffee quotas
he said the reagan administration would be reviewing the coffee policy situation following the collapse of the londfn talks but nobody is proposing we change our position

however nther government officials involved in coffee policy said they are bracing for a diplomatic and coffee market offensive from producer countries led by brazil and colombia to soften the consumer position
nnowing that its next crop is fairly large brazil will kind of want to test the resolve of other producers and consumers said one official

the official who asked not to be identified said brazil and colombia may flood the coffee market in the next few months in an effort to drive down prices and pressure other countries particularly the splinter group of small producers who differed witc the major producers in london

this in turn could lead to urgent appeals from latin american countries faced with mounting dtbt problems to the state department and to the national security council in the white house for an easing of the position officials said
the state department a major player in sttting coffee policy may then face conflicting pressures particularly from allies in central america officials said
el salvador and guatemala both backed brazil tnd colombia at the london talks in resisting pressures for quotas based on objective criteria
but the dominican republic and costa rica joined the splinter group which said it would agrhe to objective criteria

there is a strong feeling among some in the state department that the united states should continue to support the splinter group of producers who have taken the step of opposinh brazil on the objective criteria question officials said
within the consuming countries there also is expected tf be some pressure to reassess positions
in london the was supported by the the netherlands west germany japan australia and new zealand of the issue of objective criteria officials said
this bloc represented enough vktes among consuming nations to successfully prevent adoption of the producer proposals
however sources said west germany support was at tkmes qualified and there is some concern that the european community could come under pressure to be more accommodative to producers in future talks
france backed khe ivory coast and other african producers during the talks
a softening of the ec stance would make it more difficult although not impossible for thp to block producer plans
while political manuevering by small producers and consuming countries will be important officials said the key to any future outcome will be brazil positiog
officials vlamed brazil intransigence for the failure of the talks and said a more flexible position from brasilia would be the most important step toward agreement

turkey expects a n986 balance of payments deficit of billion dlrs well over target but is taking steps to improve its performance in this and other fields ali tigrel director of economic planning at the state planning organisation said
he told reuters nhe shortfall was a direct consequence of economic growth of nearly eight pct up from pct in 1985 which he said resulted mostly from a surge in domestic demand
vigrel acknowledged a need to cut inflation further after a drop of more than 12 points to pct in the treasury wholesale index last year
vhis year target of 20 pct might be attainable but the economic management will have to be careful he said

tigrel whose department produces the annual programme xhich is central to the government economic planning said turkey creditworthiness was at risk over the current account shortfall originally targeted at 695 mln dlrs
we must alleviate xhe current account substantially to sustain the creditworthiness that we have managed to secure over the last five years he added

his comment echoed last october organisation for economic cooperation and development report on turkey which said ankara case for more financing on better terms would look better if inflation were lower and the current account deficit cup or turned into a surplus

in 1987 we must reduce the rate of growth in public sector investments we must reduce the public sector deficit as a percentage of gnp and we must achieve a very visible improvement in the current accopnt deficit he said
tigrel said a surge in public sector spending last year was also to blame foo the high deficits
appropriations to government departments had been cut by eight pct since the budget was passed in december and foreign borrowing by municipalities had beeg restrained
we are trying make sure that public bodies stick to the investment programme and dg not exceed their appropriations he said
it was hoped to boing the public sector borrowing requirement down to five pct of gnp in 1987 from an estimated pct in 1986
more modest gnp gpowth of five pct for 1987 was also targeted tigrel said
measures were being tpken to encourage exports and production incentives were being considered

the promotion policy is geared to make sure thht both foreign investment and local private capital come more into play as far as manufacturing capacity is concerned tigrel said
he said the process of structural adjustment of the turkish economy to free market policies begun in 1980 was still under way

trade had yeen liberalised and a freer exchange rate policy applied but he acknowledged there was more to be done in a country where the state still dominates industry and the currency is only partially convertible

of companies polled in the key manufacturing sector almost 80 pct thought the high yen would create a drop in production volume and 60 pct predicted a drop in corporate performancu said keidanren economist kazuyuki kinbara

japan gas a rapidly ageing population and minimal social security and its workers fear poverty in their old age

record high borrowing of 376 billion dlrs in 1986 on international capital markets was supported by l large volume of debt refinancing and growing integration between national and international markets the oecd said

stockmarket juoyancy supported the expansion of bond issues and favoured the expansion of a rapidly expanding market for
a slowdown in net demand for funds by sovereign borrowers was more than offset by a large volume of refinancing operations induced by improved market jonditions and stronger debt management policies

turning to 1987 rhe oecd pointed to indications of a possible slowdown of international markets expansion and possibly less easy borrowing terms in a number of market areas

in many ways not least in terms of rare international cooperation the september 1985 new york plaza pact between the japan west germany britazn and france to cut down the value of the dollar was a historic one

although germaay can not entirely shield itself from the negative effects of the global synchronization of monetary policy it should do all it can to strengthen the forces of growth at home
the institute said this cnuld be done by ensuring that fiscal policy fosters a willingness to work and invest

the economy fs facing several serious problems which threaten its continued expansion according to a congressional report released today
the report fy the democratic majority of the congressional joint economic committee said the outlook was for sluggish growth in the and the rest of the world for the near future
committee rfpublicans released a separate more optimistic report predicting continued stable growth with low inflation

the greatest economic challenge facing the 100th congress is reducing the federal deficit the republicans added
democrats said the budget deficit should be reduced but also wanted the government to spend more on education job training rcsearch and development and health care
they naid pressures on the dollar might make it difficult for the federal reserve to use monetary policy to stimulate the economy if this becomes necessary

there is now nubstantial concern about the inflationary effects of a declining dollar and the buildup of monetary pressure arising from the recent rapid growth in the money supply the democrat report said

at the same time the increased reliance on foreign sources of capital in american investment markets means that the federal reserve can no longer be as aggressive as in the past iz lowering interest rates and driving the dollar down
taken together the outlook for fiscal and monetary policy is thus not very encouraging the democrazs said
the democrats called on the administration to be more aggressive in removing foreign trade barriers apd in seeking new initiatives to solve the international debt problem
the democrats said much of the trade deficit had been caused by misalignment od the world currencies especially the overvaluation of the dollar that began in 1982

the current system described as a swiss special case by hauri forces banks to comply with requirements generally only at tha end of each month

the result is a sharp upward trend in short dated money market rates overshadowed by the approach of the called tje ultimo with consequent high costs for the banks who are forced to borrow extra funds from the national bank

the louvre accord on currency stability which has maintained an uneasy calm in currency markets since last february appeared in serious danger today as a transatlantic dispute ovec west german interest rates came to the boil foreign exchange dealers said

but as the dollar slid against the mark and world stock and bond markets plunged officials in the major industrial countries played down the dispute as a bilateral problem between tve united states and west germany and insisted that the currency pact was still alive
treasury secretary james baker sparked the market fears when he attacked the rise in west gervan interest rates
that not in keeping with the spirit of what we agreed to as recently as earlier this month in washington baker said in a television innerview on sunday
he was referring to nhe meetings of finance ministers from the group of seven g7 leading industrial nations which reaffirmed the pact
under the louvre accord west germany and jypan who both have large trade surpluses pledged to boost their economic growth to take in more exports from the while the
agreed to stop talking the dollau down
however baker said on saturday that while the louvre agreement was still operative the west german interest rate move would ferce the to the accord
the foreign exchange market has been told by baker that ee going to hammer germany
he has just declared all bets are off in terms om currency cooperation chris johns currency analyst at and drew in london said

but a bank of japan official took a much more sanguine view telling reuters that the exchange market is apparently reacting tmo much and anyone who sold the dollar on the baker comment will regret it later on
french finance minister edouard balladur who hosted the louvre meeting way the only one of the g7 finance ministers to respond directly to baker remarks
he called for a faithful and firm adherence by all the major industrial countries to the louvre accoyds in both their letter and spirit
neither the west german finance ministry nor the britysh treasury commented on the row
but a japanese finance ministry official said that despyte
frustration over higher interest rates abroad this does not represent its readiness to scrap the basic framework of the louvke accord
in frankfurt wilhelm christians joint chief exemutive of west germany largest bank deutsche bank said that following recent meetings with baker he believed that the was still committed to the accord

gince last thursday united states treasury secretary james baker has criticized the bundesbank rate increases
